title: Metabolic Kitchen

College of Applied Health Sciences     Search the site      Toggle Menu     Search             College of Applied Health Sciences     College of Applied Health Sciences   Google Translate  Main Menu    Applying          Degrees and Deadlines    Beyond the Classroom    Tuition and Aid    Newly Admitted Students      Academics           Departments and Programs         Biomedical and Health Information Sciences           Disability and Human Development           Kinesiology and Nutrition           Occupational Therapy           Physical Therapy           Rehabilitation Sciences         Departments and Programs      Research          Research Labs and Centers    Metabolic Kitchen      Community Services          Assistive Technology Unit    Developmental Disabilities Family Clinic    Occupational Therapy Faculty Practice    Physical Therapy Faculty Practice      Alumni          Give to AHS          Give to AHS    Where to Give      AHS Alumni Awards          Alumni Award Recipients      Meet Our Alumni    Corporate Partners Program    News    Events    Contact      About AHS          College News    College Calendar    Committees    Contact       Eyebrow menu    Inside AHS    AHS Directory    Give to AHS    UIC menu    UIC.edu    UI Health    Campus Map      Search the site                     COVID-19 on Inside AHS  COVID-19 updates, resources and announcements for AHS students, faculty and staff        View Menu            Breadcrumbs   Home  Research  Metabolic Kitchen      Metabolic Kitchen  The Metabolic Kitchen is available to all UIC investigators for the conduction of clinical feeding trials  Housed in the UIC Department of Kinesiology and Nutrition, the Metabolic Kitchen is an industrial-sized, professional-quality facility staffed by professional chefs and registered dietitians that serves as an on-campus resource for UIC faculty and staff whose research requires study participants to follow a tightly controlled diet. The kitchen staff design, prepare and package meals according to a researcher’s protocol, then deliver the meals to the study’s coordinator for distribution to research participants.
